property.name: text
property.value:
When an event is received on the eventTrigger port the receipt time is sent to the eventTime port.
The clockRate parameter port sets the clockRate attribute of the DE director. This in turn is the rate parameter used by the director in computing the advancment of the local clock with respect to its environment. A clockRate of 1.0 indicates that the local and environment clocks run at the same rate, i.e. have the same definition of the second.

property.name: text
property.value:
When an event is received on the eventTrigger port the receipt time is sent to the eventTime port.
The clockRate parameter port sets the clockRate attribute of the DE director. This in turn is the rate parameter used by the director in computing the advancment of the local clock with respect to its environment. A clockRate of 1.0 indicates that the local and environment clocks run at the same rate, i.e. have the same definition of the second.

entity.name: PID
entity.doc: Discrete proportional, integral, and derivative controller.

property.name: text
property.value:
Since the input events occur at different times, the "TriggerEverySecondEvent" block generates a trigger on every second event to ensure that the difference between the two event times is computed correctly.
The equations for determining X are as follows: velocity(TA-T0)= X X is the distance from the fault to substation A. T0 is time of fault, TA fault detection time at substation A velocity(TB-T0)= B - X B-X is the distance from substation B to the fault. TB is the fault detection time at substation B.
Hence: X = 0.5*[B + velocity(TA-TB)]

svg.text: Generates an output event after the receipt of every two input events.
